item.title: Bayer CEO Says Breakup Wouldn't Fix All of the Company's Ills
item.description: Negative news and a share-price slump have reignited calls for the German crop-and-pharmaceutical group to spin off businesses.

item.title: Gaza Diplomacy Cements Qatar's Role as Mediator
item.description: The Persian Gulf state’s ties to militants and pariah countries are part of its strategy to stay secure and relevant.

item.title: An obscure zinc smelter in Tennessee is sitting on two minerals vital to producing chips for smartphones and radar systems, landing it in the middle of a global trade war.
item.description: An obscure zinc smelter in Tennessee is sitting on two minerals vital to producing chips for smartphones and radar systems, landing it in the middle of a global trade war.

item.title: Stocks solidified a fourth consecutive week of gains, after bouncing between small gains and losses Friday. The S&P 500 and Dow rose 0.1% and 0.3%, respectively, while the Nasdaq fell 0.1%.
item.description: Stocks solidified a fourth consecutive week of gains, after bouncing between small gains and losses Friday. The S&P 500 and Dow rose 0.1% and 0.3%, respectively, while the Nasdaq fell 0.1%.

item.title: Millions of Americans headed to stores on Black Friday, but retailers are navigating through a holiday season in which shoppers aren't splurging as much as they have in recent years.
item.description: Millions of Americans headed to stores on Black Friday, but retailers are navigating through a holiday season in which shoppers aren’t splurging as much as they have in recent years.

item.title: Oscar Pistorius, the former Olympic and Paralympic track star who was convicted of murdering his girlfriend, was granted parole after serving half of his 15-year sentence.
item.description: Oscar Pistorius, the former Olympic and Paralympic track star who was convicted of murdering his girlfriend, was granted parole after serving half of his 15-year sentence.

item.title: The Israeli military has stepped up efforts to produce evidence that Gaza's largest hospital was a Hamas command center, as the humanitarian fallout from war andseizure of Al-Shifa Hospitalhas heaped pressure on Israel.
item.description: The Israeli military has stepped up efforts to produce evidence that Gaza’s largest hospital was a Hamas command center, as the humanitarian fallout from war and seizure of Al-Shifa Hospital has heaped pressure on Israel.

item.title: Amazon faced strikes in the U.S. and Europe, hitting the company at the start of the busy holiday shopping weekend.
item.description: Amazon faced strikes in the U.S. and Europe, hitting the company at the start of the busy holiday shopping weekend.

item.title: Hamas has released 24 hostages taken from Israel, according to Israeli and Qatari officials, the initial phase in a deal that has paused fighting in the Gaza war. The first 39 Palestinian women and teenagers were also released from Israeli prisons.
item.description: Hamas has released 24 hostages taken from Israel, according to Israeli and Qatari officials, the initial phase in a deal that has paused fighting in the Gaza war. The first 39 Palestinian women and teenagers were also released from Israeli prisons.

item.title: Sean "Diddy" Combs was accused of sexual abuse in two lawsuits, a week after the rapper and entrepreneur settled a separate case with a former girlfriend.
item.description: Sean “Diddy” Combs was accused of sexual abuse in two lawsuits, a week after the rapper and entrepreneur settled a separate case with a former girlfriend.

item.title: Ireland witnessed its worst civil disorder in decades as rioters marauded through Dublin city center looting shops and setting buses and police cars on fire, seemingly in response toa stabbing attack that injured three children.
item.description: Ireland witnessed its worst civil disorder in decades as rioters marauded through Dublin city center looting shops and setting buses and police cars on fire, seemingly in response to a stabbing attack that injured three children.

item.title: Nissan is expanding its electric vehicles and battery manufacturing capacity in the U.K. with investments of up to $2.39 billion.
item.description: Nissan is expanding its electric vehicles and battery manufacturing capacity in the U.K. with investments of up to $2.39 billion.

item.title: A former executive assistant to Andrew Cuomo has sued the former New York governor for sexual harassment.
item.description: A former executive assistant to Andrew Cuomo has sued the former New York governor for sexual harassment.

item.title: Sectors that have been bruised by higher interest rates and recession fears are rebounding to help drive a year-end surge in the stock market.

item.title: Behind Credit Suisse's Fall: A Chairman's Lasting Mark on the Culture
item.description: Insiders and investors say the bank’s board, headed by Urs Rohner, was ultimately responsible for its fate.

item.title: Nikki Haley's Challenge: Keep Anti-Trump GOP Vote, Add Some Trump Backers
item.description: Her recent surge in GOP polls tests appetite for a more traditional Republican.

item.title: Canada Takes $651 Million Write-down on Trans Mountain Pipeline Project
item.description: Trans Mountain said it booked a net loss in the third quarter because of a goodwill impairment charge.
